00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Bottleneck traveling salesman problem (BTSP) methods.
00003  *
00004  * Heuristic for solving the bottleneck traveling salesman problem (BTSP).
00005  *
00006  * @author  John LaRusic
00007  * @ingroup lib
00008  ****************************************************************************/
00009 #include "common.h"
00010 #include "btsp.h"
00011 
00012 /****************************************************************************
00013  * Private function prototypes
00014  ****************************************************************************/
00015 /**
00016  *  @brief  Solves the feasibility problem which attempts to determine if 
00017  *          there is a Hamiltonian cycle using costs <= delta.
00018  *  @param  problem [in] problem to solve
00019  *  @param  num_steps [in] total number of steps in solve plan
00020  *  @param  steps [in] solve plan step details
00021  *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter for feasibility problem.
00022  *  @param  feasible [out] true if a feasible tour exists, false otherwise
00023  *  @param  result [out] resulting BTSP tour found
00024  */
00025 int
00026 feasible(arrow_problem *problem, int num_steps, arrow_btsp_solve_plan *steps, 
00027          int delta, int *feasible, arrow_btsp_result *result);
00028 
00029 
00030 /****************************************************************************
00031  * Public function implementations
00032  ****************************************************************************/
00033 int 
00034 arrow_btsp_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info,
00035                  arrow_btsp_params *params, arrow_btsp_result *result)
00036 {    
00037     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00038     int is_feasible;
00039     int i, low, high, median, median_val;
00040     double start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00041     
00042     arrow_btsp_result cur_result;
00043     arrow_btsp_result_init(problem, &cur_result);
00044     
00045     result->optimal = ARROW_FALSE;
00046     result->found_tour = ARROW_FALSE;
00047 
00048     /* Print out debug information */
00049     arrow_debug("Confirm solution?: %s\n", 
00050         params->confirm_sol == ARROW_TRUE ? "Yes" : "No");
00051     arrow_debug("Supress EBST?: %s\n", 
00052         params->supress_ebst == ARROW_TRUE ? "Yes" : "No");
00053     arrow_debug("Find short tour?: %s\n", 
00054         params->find_short_tour == ARROW_TRUE ? "Yes" : "No");
00055     arrow_debug("Initial Lower Bound: %d\n", params->lower_bound);
00056     arrow_debug("Initial Upper Bound: %d\n", params->upper_bound);  
00057     if(params->num_steps > 0)
00058     {
00059         arrow_debug("Total solve steps: %d\n", params->num_steps);
00060     }
00061     arrow_debug("\n");
00062     
00063     /* Start enhanced threshold heuristic */
00064     arrow_debug("Starting enhanced threshold heuristic\n");
00065     arrow_debug("Current solution: %d\n", result->obj_value);
00066     ret = feasible(problem, params->num_steps, params->steps, 
00067                    params->lower_bound, &is_feasible, result);
00068     if(ret != ARROW_SUCCESS)
00069     {
00070         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00071         goto CLEANUP;
00072     }
00073     if(is_feasible)
00074     {
00075         arrow_debug("A tour was found!.\n");
00076         result->optimal = ARROW_TRUE;
00077         result->found_tour = ARROW_TRUE;
00078         goto CONFIRM;
00079     }
00080     
00081     /* Start enhanced binary search threshold heuristic */
00082     if(params->supress_ebst) goto CONFIRM;
00083     arrow_debug("\nStarting enhanced binary search threshold heuristic.\n");
00084 
00085     ret = arrow_util_binary_search(info->cost_list, info->cost_list_length,
00086                                    params->lower_bound, &low);
00087     if(!ret)
00088     {
00089         low--;
00090         arrow_debug("Lower bound not in cost list, so pick next lowest\n");
00091         arrow_debug("Next lowest cost is %d...", info->cost_list[low]);
00092     }
00093     
00094     int upper_bound = params->upper_bound;
00095     if(result->obj_value < upper_bound) upper_bound = result->obj_value;
00096     if(upper_bound == INT_MAX)
00097     {
00098         arrow_debug("Taking largest cost as upperbound...\n");
00099         high = info->cost_list_length - 1;
00100     }
00101     else
00102     {
00103         ret = arrow_util_binary_search(info->cost_list, info->cost_list_length,
00104                                        upper_bound, &high);
00105     }
00106     
00107     arrow_debug("Starting binary search.\n");
00108     while(low != high)
00109     {
00110         median = ((high - low) / 2) + low;
00111         median_val = info->cost_list[median];
00112         arrow_debug("low = %d; high = %d; median = %d\n", 
00113                     info->cost_list[low], info->cost_list[high], median_val);
00114         
00115         ret = feasible(problem, params->num_steps, params->steps, 
00116                        median_val, &is_feasible, &cur_result);
00117         if(ret != ARROW_SUCCESS)
00118         {
00119             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00120             goto CLEANUP;
00121         }
00122         
00123         if(is_feasible)
00124         {
00125             arrow_debug("A tour was found!\n");
00126             result->found_tour = ARROW_TRUE;
00127             
00128             /* Check to see if we found a smaller solution than our median */
00129             if(cur_result.obj_value < median_val)
00130             {
00131                 arrow_debug(" - Found a smaller solution than our median: %d\n",
00132                             cur_result.obj_value);
00133                 arrow_util_binary_search(info->cost_list, 
00134                                          info->cost_list_length,
00135                                          cur_result.obj_value, &high);
00136             }
00137             else
00138             {
00139                 high = median;
00140             }
00141             
00142             /* Copy over new best objective value and tour */
00143             result->obj_value = cur_result.obj_value;
00144             result->tour_length = cur_result.tour_length;
00145             if(result->tour != NULL)
00146             {
00147                 result->found_tour = ARROW_TRUE;
00148                 for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00149                     result->tour[i] = cur_result.tour[i];
00150             }   
00151         }
00152         else
00153         {
00154             arrow_debug("A tour could not be found.\n");
00155             low = median + 1;
00156             
00157             /* Check to see if we found a smaller solution than our median */
00158             if(cur_result.obj_value < median_val)
00159             {
00160                 arrow_debug(" - Found a smaller solution than our best: %d\n",
00161                             cur_result.obj_value);
00162                 arrow_debug(" - Lower upper bound to this value\n");
00163                 arrow_util_binary_search(info->cost_list, 
00164                                          info->cost_list_length,
00165                                          cur_result.obj_value, &high);
00166                                          
00167                 /* Copy over new best objective value and tour */
00168                 result->obj_value = cur_result.obj_value;
00169                 if(result->tour != NULL)
00170                 {
00171                     result->found_tour = ARROW_TRUE;
00172                     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00173                         result->tour[i] = cur_result.tour[i];
00174                 }
00175             }
00176             
00177             if(low > high) low = high;
00178         }
00179         arrow_debug("\n");
00180         
00181         /* Copy over other important information */
00182         result->bin_search_steps++;
00183         for(i = 0; i < ARROW_TSP_SOLVER_COUNT; i++)
00184         {
00185             result->solver_attempts[i] += cur_result.solver_attempts[i];
00186             result->solver_time[i] += cur_result.solver_time[i];
00187         }
00188     }
00189 
00190     /* Confirm the solution if required.  If we can find a Hamiltonian cycle
00191        using costs strictly less than our objective value, then our tour
00192        is not optimal. */
00193 CONFIRM:
00194     if(params->confirm_sol)
00195     {
00196         arrow_debug("Confirming solution...\n");
00197         arrow_btsp_solve_plan confirm_plan_steps[1] = 
00198         {
00199            params->confirm_plan
00200         };
00201         
00202         printf("checking feasibility...\n");
00203         ret = feasible(problem, 1, confirm_plan_steps, 
00204                        result->obj_value - 1, &is_feasible, &cur_result);
00205         if(ret != ARROW_SUCCESS)
00206         {
00207             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00208             goto CLEANUP;
00209         }
00210         
00211         if(is_feasible)
00212         {
00213             arrow_debug("Tour found -- solution not optimal.\n");
00214             result->found_tour = ARROW_TRUE;
00215             
00216             /* Copy over new best objective value and tour */
00217             result->obj_value = cur_result.obj_value;
00218             result->tour_length = cur_result.tour_length;
00219             if(result->tour != NULL)
00220             {
00221                 result->found_tour = ARROW_TRUE;
00222                 for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00223                     result->tour[i] = cur_result.tour[i];
00224             }   
00225         }
00226         else
00227         {
00228             arrow_debug("Tour could not be found -- solution optimal!\n");
00229             result->optimal = ARROW_TRUE;
00230         }
00231         
00232         result->solver_attempts[ARROW_TSP_CC_EXACT] 
00233             += cur_result.solver_attempts[ARROW_TSP_CC_EXACT];
00234         result->solver_time[ARROW_TSP_CC_EXACT] 
00235             += cur_result.solver_time[ARROW_TSP_CC_EXACT];
00236     }
00237 
00238                            
00239 CLEANUP:
00240     /* See if we've reached the lower bound to guarantee optimality */
00241     if(result->obj_value == params->lower_bound)
00242     {
00243         result->optimal = ARROW_TRUE;
00244         
00245     }
00246     result->total_time = arrow_util_zeit() - start_time;
00247 
00248     arrow_btsp_result_destruct(&cur_result);
00249     return ret;
00250 }
00251 
00252 
00253 /****************************************************************************
00254  * Private function implementations
00255  ****************************************************************************/
00256 int
00257 feasible(arrow_problem *problem, int num_steps, arrow_btsp_solve_plan *steps, 
00258          int delta, int *feasible, arrow_btsp_result *result)
00259 {
00260     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00261     int i, j, k;
00262     int u, v;
00263     double len;
00264        
00265     *feasible = ARROW_FALSE;
00266     result->found_tour = ARROW_FALSE;
00267     result->obj_value = INT_MAX;
00268     result->tour_length = DBL_MAX;
00269     for(i = 0; i < ARROW_TSP_SOLVER_COUNT; i++)
00270     {
00271         result->solver_attempts[i] = 0;
00272         result->solver_time[i] = 0.0;
00273     }
00274     result->total_time = 0.0;
00275     
00276     /* This holds the current tour that was found and its length */
00277     arrow_tsp_result tsp_result;
00278     arrow_tsp_result_init(problem, &tsp_result);
00279     
00280     arrow_debug("Feasibility problem for delta = %d\n", delta);
00281     for(i = 0; i < num_steps; i++)
00282     {
00283         arrow_btsp_solve_plan *plan = &(steps[i]);
00284         arrow_btsp_fun *fun = &(plan->fun);
00285                 
00286         arrow_debug("Step %d of %d:\n", i + 1, num_steps);
00287         
00288         for(j = 1; j <= plan->attempts; j++)
00289         {
00290             arrow_debug("Attempt %d of %d:\n", j, plan->attempts);
00291             
00292             /* Create a new problem based upon the solve plan */
00293             arrow_problem new_problem;
00294             if(!arrow_btsp_fun_apply(fun, problem, delta, &new_problem))
00295             {
00296                 ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00297                 goto CLEANUP;
00298             }
00299                                                     
00300             /* Call a TSP solver on new problem */      
00301             ret = arrow_tsp_solve(plan->tsp_solver, &new_problem, 
00302                                   plan->tsp_params, &tsp_result);
00303             if(!ret)
00304             {
00305                 ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00306                 arrow_tsp_result_destruct(&tsp_result);
00307                 arrow_problem_destruct(&new_problem);
00308                 goto CLEANUP;   
00309             }
00310             
00311             result->solver_attempts[plan->tsp_solver] += 1;
00312             printf("TSP Solver Time: %.2f\n", tsp_result.total_time);
00313             result->solver_time[plan->tsp_solver] += tsp_result.total_time;            
00314             
00315             /* Determine if we have found a tour of feasible length or not */
00316             arrow_debug("Found a tour of length %.0f\n", 
00317                         tsp_result.obj_value);
00318             *feasible = fun->feasible(fun, problem, delta, 
00319                                       tsp_result.obj_value, tsp_result.tour);
00320             if(*feasible)
00321             {
00322                 /* Set this tour to the output variables then exit */
00323                 arrow_debug(" - tour found is feasible.\n");
00324                 result->found_tour = ARROW_TRUE;
00325                 result->obj_value = delta;
00326 
00327                 len = 0.0;
00328                 for(k = 0; k < problem->size; k++)
00329                 {
00330                     u = tsp_result.tour[k];
00331                     v = tsp_result.tour[(k + 1) % problem->size];
00332                     len += problem->get_cost(problem, u, v);
00333                     if(result->tour != NULL)
00334                         result->tour[k] = tsp_result.tour[k];
00335                 }
00336                 arrow_debug(" - actual tour is of length %.0f\n", len);
00337                 result->tour_length = len;
00338                     
00339                 arrow_debug("Finished feasibility question.\n");
00340                 goto CLEANUP;
00341             }
00342             /** TODO: Find a better way of doing this upper bound update */
00343             /*
00344             else if(plan->upper_bound_update)
00345             {
00346                 printf("Check to see if we found a better upper bound...\n");
00347                 max_cost = INT_MIN;
00348                 len = 0.0;
00349                 for(k = 0; k < problem->size; k++)
00350                 {
00351                     u = tsp_result.tour[k];
00352                     v = tsp_result.tour[(k + 1) % problem->size];
00353                     cost = problem->get_cost(problem, u, v);
00354                     len += cost;
00355                     if(cost > max_cost) max_cost = cost;
00356                 }
00357                 
00358                 if(max_cost < result->obj_value)
00359                 {
00360                     arrow_debug(" - tour is the best one found so far.\n");
00361                     arrow_debug(" - max. cost is %d\n", max_cost);
00362                     result->found_tour = ARROW_TRUE;
00363                     result->obj_value = max_cost;
00364                     arrow_debug(" - actual tour is of length %.0f\n", len);
00365                     result->tour_length = len;
00366                     if(result->tour != NULL)
00367                     {
00368                         for(k = 0; k < problem->size; k++)
00369                             result->tour[k] = tsp_result.tour[k];
00370                     }
00371                 }
00372             }
00373             */
00374             /* Clean up */
00375             arrow_problem_destruct(&new_problem);
00376         }
00377     }
00378     arrow_debug("Finished feasibility problem finding no feasible tours.\n");
00379     
00380 CLEANUP:
00381     arrow_tsp_result_destruct(&tsp_result);
00382     return ret;
00383 }
